styles.h1: font-heading text-4xl md:text-5xl font-bold tracking-tight text-[var(--text-color)]
styles.h2: font-heading text-2xl md:text-3xl font-semibold tracking-tight text-[var(--text-color)]
styles.caption: font-body text-sm text-[var(--text-light)] opacity-80

layout_strategy.container: min-h-screen flex flex-col items-center justify-center p-4 md:p-8 bg-[hsl(var(--background))] pattern-paper
layout_strategy.main_card: w-full max-w-4xl bg-[hsl(var(--card))] rounded-xl shadow-2xl overflow-hidden border border-[hsl(var(--border))]/10

buttons.default: rounded-full px-8 py-3 font-medium transition-all duration-300 active:scale-95

inputs.default: rounded-lg border-2 border-[hsl(var(--input))]/20 bg-transparent px-4 py-2 text-[hsl(var(--foreground))] focus:border-[hsl(var(--primary))] focus:outline-none focus:ring-0 transition-colors

file_upload.container: relative border-2 border-dashed border-[hsl(var(--primary))]/40 rounded-xl p-12 text-center hover:bg-[hsl(var(--accent))]/10 transition-colors cursor-pointer group
file_upload.icon: w-16 h-16 mx-auto mb-4 text-[hsl(var(--primary))]/60 group-hover:text-[hsl(var(--primary))] transition-colors

assets.icons: lucide-react (FileSpreadsheet, Upload, Download, Loader2, X, CheckCircle, AlertCircle)

images.hero_bg: Use CSS pattern or subtle noise texture if possible, otherwise solid color

universal_guidelines: Use generous padding (p-8, p-12) to create breathing room.
Avoid default gray scales. Use the tinted brown/beige scale for all neutrals.
Ensure high contrast for text reading. Use the darkest brown for primary text.
Add a subtle noise texture to the background to enhance the 'paper' feel if possible.
Do not use gradients for the primary button, stick to solid Saddle Brown.
Center the main converter card but align text inside it left for readability.
Use 'sonner' for toast notifications with custom styling to match the earthy theme.
instructions_to_main_agent: Update tailwind.config.js to include the custom colors and font families.
Add the Google Fonts import to index.css or index.html.
Create a 'Layout' component that wraps the page with the background color.
Use 'react-dropzone' (if available or standard input) for the file upload.
Implement the file conversion flow: Upload -> Preview (Mock/Real) -> Convert -> Download.
For the preview, if actual extraction is complex on frontend, show a mock table or metadata first.
Ensure the 'Progress' component uses the primary/accent colors.
